channel.title: home on Gustav Jansson
channel.description: Recent content in home on Gustav Jansson

item.title: week18
item.description: This week I continued working on this homepage, scaling images to fit in the design and it’s taking longer than expected. I also finally restarted my tile based 3d level editor called t3d. Since it’s still in its infancy there arent any pretty pictures so I’ll keep it here in the devlog for now.

item.title: week17
item.description: Much of the page is now in “kinda working” order. There are still projects missing images and download links, and most projects have the wrong header image size. There only one thing to do, and that’s keep on working on it.

item.title: week16
item.description: This week I did a little work on gaf, but my whole weeked was spent on moving my blogs and page to this new hugo based page. It isn’t done yet, but hopefully soon.

item.title: week15
item.description: This week I continued working on gaf, now supporting json loading and default values, next up is array support (yay)

item.title: week14
item.description: I continued working on gaf, and currently it parses a few test files, generate some c++11 code and runs a few unit tests on Travis. Next up is adding Json io and enums or arrays

item.title: week13
item.description: Last week was kinda productive despite a birthday party in Germany. I finally started on gaf, the game format file format generator, and separated the game and the engine part of spacetyper into super and sub repos.

item.title: week12
item.description: Last week wasn’t that eventful. Life got in my way I guess so no code was neither written nor committed. Better luck next(this) week I guess…

item.title: week11
item.description: I did nothing at all this week except watching Netflix. I managed to watch the entire Jessica Jones season 1 though so I’m both proud and appalled about my accomplishment.

item.title: week10
item.description: I haven’t really been doing that much last week. Instead of staring designing or coding the 2d rendering system I started on separating the engine repo from the game repo, but nothing is complete yet. I hope I’ll be able to finish it this week.

item.title: week9
item.description: This week I didn’t do much, except implementing radix sort with count sort as the second sorter. Pretty standard I guess but it wasn’t in my toolbox library and I will need it for the upcoming render optimization

item.title: week8
item.description: This week I replaced the built-in assert with a custom one to get callstack information, and I’ve also finally completed the rewrite of the new opengl buffer rendering.

item.title: Shoelacing
item.description: I recently bought new shoes and needed to lace them, hence it’s time to google how to lace shoes again. Ians shoelace site is my favorite and I’ve been visiting it for what it seems like an eternity. I don’t know much about the competition, but I can’t find anything missing from it. It’s the best! http://www.fieggen.com/shoelace/

item.title: Keep your ubuntu-gnome from waking up at random
item.description: I have tried using /proc/acpi/wakeup and I’ve tried looking in /sys/bus/usb/devices/SOMETHING/power/wakeup for devices that will wake up the computer, however I finally fixed my random wakeup problems with a tool called acpitool. It is really quite simple. First you need to install it, unless you already have it installed: $ sudo apt-get install acpitool Once it’s installed you can list what you can do with it, and to make it works.

item.title: Non recursive file searching in Nautilus
item.description: Recursive search is the default in nautilus (search in subfolders), but I prefer type ahead search(only search in current folder). This is easy to change, but not very obvious. In dconf-editor navigate to org > gnome > nautilus > preferences and set the enable-interactive-search value to what you’d like to use. http://www.webupd8.org/2014/01/nautilus-type-ahead-find-feature.html

item.title: Revert google+ to a standard blogger profile on blogger
item.description: It turns out google has removed it from various links, so I don’t know how long this link will last, but here it goes: http://www.blogger.com/revert-profile.gï»¿ Pretty simple but it took far too long to find it.

item.title: Folders before files in ubuntu
item.description: I like to view folders before my files with Files/Nautilus, and here is how to enable it: In dconf-editor navigate to: org.gnome.nautilus.preferences key and set sort-directories-first to true.

item.title: Windows 10 wakes up from sleep at random
item.description: After upgrading to Windows 10, my computer started randomly waking up. This extensive guide on superuser has proven time and time again to be a perfect guide to keep windows from waking up.

item.title: Test markdown
item.description: Here’s a code chunk with syntax highlighting: var foo = function(x) { return(x + 5); } foo(3) $ echo $EDITOR vim $ git checkout master Switched to branch 'master' Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master'. $ git push Everything up-to-date $ echo 'All > done!' All done! You can write regular markdown here and Jekyll will automatically convert it to a nice webpage. I strongly encourage you to take 5 minutes to learn how to write in markdown - it’ll teach you how to transform regular text into bold/italics/headings/tables/etc.
